successQueries.name: createVisualNode
successQueries.reason: Ensures that a node visually appears in the UI canvas when created.

successQueries.name: updateNodePropertyVisual
successQueries.query: MATCH (n:Person { name: 'Alice' }) SET n.age = 30 RETURN n
successQueries.reason: Checks if updating a node property is reflected in the UI canvas.

successQueries.name: createVisualRelationship
successQueries.query: MATCH (a:Person { name: 'Alice' }), (b:Person { name: 'Bob' }) CREATE (a)-[:FRIENDS_WITH]->(b) RETURN a, b
successQueries.reason: Validates that a relationship visually appears between nodes in the UI canvas.

successQueries.name: deleteVisualNode
successQueries.reason: Confirms that a node disappears from the UI canvas when deleted.

successQueries.name: deleteVisualRelationship
successQueries.query: MATCH (a:Person)-[r:FRIENDS_WITH]-(b:Person) DELETE r RETURN a, b
successQueries.reason: Ensures that deleting a relationship is reflected visually in the UI canvas.

successQueries.name: mergeVisualNode
successQueries.reason: Tests if the UI correctly handles MERGE by displaying the node only if it doesn't already exist.

successQueries.name: expandGraphView
successQueries.reason: Ensures that the UI can display multiple nodes and relationships in the canvas.

successQueries.name: collapseGraphView
successQueries.reason: Checks if the UI supports zooming or focusing on a single node in the canvas.

successQueries.name: displayMultipleNodes
successQueries.query: CREATE (a:Person { name: 'Alice' }), (b:Person { name: 'Bob' }), (c:Person { name: 'Charlie' }) RETURN a, b, c
successQueries.reason: Verifies that multiple nodes appear in the canvas without issue.

successQueries.name: displayMultipleRelationships
successQueries.query: MATCH (a:Person { name: 'Alice' }), (b:Person { name: 'Bob' }), (c:Person { name: 'Charlie' }) CREATE (a)-[:FRIENDS_WITH]->(b), (b)-[:FRIENDS_WITH]->(c) RETURN a, b, c
successQueries.reason: Ensures that multiple relationships between nodes are rendered correctly in the UI canvas.

successQueries.name: checkNodeTooltip
successQueries.reason: Tests whether the UI correctly displays tooltips or properties when clicking on a node in the canvas.

successQueries.name: checkRelationshipTooltip
successQueries.reason: Tests whether the UI correctly displays tooltips or properties when clicking on a relationship in the canvas.

testQueries.name: batchCreatePersons
testQueries.query: UNWIND range(1, 10) AS i CREATE (p:Person {id: i, name: 'Person ' + toString(i)}) RETURN p;
testQueries.reason: Creates 10 Person nodes with sequential IDs and names using UNWIND.

testQueries.name: fetchFirstTenNodes
testQueries.reason: Retrieves up to 10 nodes from the database without any filtering.

testQueries.name: createSamplePersons
testQueries.reason: Creates two sample Person nodes with name and age properties for testing.

testQueries.name: fetchNodeDetails
testQueries.query: MATCH (n) RETURN n.name AS Name, labels(n) AS Labels, n.age AS Age
testQueries.reason: Retrieves node details including name, labels, and age from the database.

testQueries.name: createTenConnectedNodes
testQueries.query: UNWIND range(1, 10) AS i CREATE (p:Person {id: i, name: 'Person ' + toString(i)}) WITH collect(p) AS people UNWIND range(0, 8) AS idx WITH people[idx] AS a, people[idx + 1] AS b CREATE (a)-[r:KNOWS]->(b) RETURN a, b, r
testQueries.reason: Creates 10 Person nodes and connects each node to the next using KNOWS relationships, then returns the nodes and edges for canvas visualization.
